ValueObjectDescriptor.description: The abstract *Value Object Descriptor* parent class. All attributes of this parent class are inherited by descendent classes.

VariationDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing VRS Variation value objects.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

variation.description: MUST be a `Variation` or CURIE reference to a `Variation`.

molecule_context.description: The molecular context of this variant. Must be one of "genomic", "transcript", or "protein".

structural_type.description: The structural variant type associated with this variant. We RECOMMEND a descendent term of [SO:0001537](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_release/term/SO:0001537).

expressions.description: Typically HGVS or ISCN nomenclature expressions. Other systems relevant to the description of variation MAY be used.

gene_context.description: A specific gene context that applies to this variant.

vrs_ref_allele_seq.description: A `VRS Sequence`_ corresponding to a "ref allele", describing the sequence expected at a `VRS SequenceLocation`_ reference.

allelic_state.description: We RECOMMEND that the *allelic_state* of a variation be described by terms from the Genotype Ontology (GENO). These SHOULD descend from concept `GENO:0000875 <http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENO_0000875>`.

ConditionDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing Condition domain entities.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

GeneDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing Gene domain entities.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

DiseaseDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing Disease domain entities.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

PhenotypeDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing Disease domain entities.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

TherapeuticDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing Therapeutic domain entities.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

TherapeuticCollectionDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing TherapeuticsCollection domain entities.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

Expression.description: Representation of a variation by a specified nomenclature or syntax for a Variation object. Common examples of expressions for the description of molecular variation include the HGVS and ISCN nomenclatures.

CategoricalVariationDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing Categorical Variation value objects.

CanonicalVariationDescriptor.description: This descriptor class is used for describing Canonical Variation value objects.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

label.description: A primary label for the value object.

description.description: A free-text description of the value object.

xrefs.description: List of CURIEs representing associated concepts.

alternate_labels.description: List of strings representing alternate labels for the value object.

members.description: VariationMember instances that fall within the functional domain of the Categorical Variation.

canonical_variation.description: MUST be a `CategoricalVariation` or a CURIE reference to a `CategoricalVariation`.

VariationMember.description: A compact class for representing a variation context that is a member of a Categorical Variation. It supports one or more Expressions of a Variation and optionally an associated VRS ID.

RecordMetadata.description: A re-usable structure that encapsulates provenance metadata that applies to a specific concrete record of information as encoded in a particular system, as opposed to  provenance of the abstract information content/knowledge the record represents.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system, or may refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in another system (e.g. a CURIE).

Coding.description: A `coding` is an extensible entity for labeling or otherwise annotating globally  namespaced identifiers known as "codes".

id.description: The `coding.id` field is used to capture the code as a CURIE.

Extension.description: The Extension class provides VODs with a means to extend descriptions with other attributes unique to a content provider. These extensions are not expected to be natively understood under VRSATILE, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes when needed.

CURIE.description: A [W3C Compact URI](https://www.w3.org/TR/curie/) formatted string. A CURIE string has the structure ``prefix``:``reference``, as defined by the W3C syntax.

Disease.description: A reference to a Disease as defined by an authority. For human diseases, the use of [MONDO](https://registry.identifiers.org/registry/mondo) as the disease authority is RECOMMENDED.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

Phenotype.description: A reference to a Phenotype as defined by an authority. For human phenotypes, the use of [HPO](https://registry.identifiers.org/registry/hpo) as the disease authority is RECOMMENDED.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

Gene.description: A reference to a Gene as defined by an authority. For human genes, the use of [hgnc](https://registry.identifiers.org/registry/hgnc) as the gene authority is RECOMMENDED.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

Condition.description: A set of phenotype and/or disease concepts that constitute a condition.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

type.description: The schema class that is instantiated by the data object. Must be the name of a class from  the VA schema.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

CombinationTherapeuticCollection.description: A collection of therapeutics that are taken during a course of treatment.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

members.description: The therapeutics that constitute the described collection.

SubstituteTherapeuticCollection.description: A collection of therapeutics that are considered as valid alternative entities.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

members.description: The therapeutics that constitute the described collection.

Variation.description: A representation of the state of one or more biomolecules.

MolecularVariation.description: A variation on a contiguous molecule.

UtilityVariation.description: A collection of Variation subclasses that cannot be constrained to a specific class of biological variation, but are necessary for some applications of VRS.

SystemicVariation.description: A Variation of multiple molecules in the context of a system, e.g. a genome, sample, or homologous chromosomes.

Allele.description: The state of a molecule at a Location.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

state.description: An expression of the sequence state

Haplotype.description: A set of non-overlapping Allele members that co-occur on the same molecule.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

members.description: List of Alleles, or references to Alleles, that comprise this Haplotype.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

definition.description: A textual representation of variation not representable by other subclasses of Variation.

VariationSet.description: An unconstrained set of Variation members.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

members.description: List of Variation objects or identifiers. Attribute is required, but MAY be empty.

CopyNumberCount.description: The absolute count of discrete copies of a Location or Gene, within a system (e.g. genome, cell, etc.).

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

subject.description: A location for which the number of systemic copies is described.

copies.description: The integral number of copies of the subject in a system

CopyNumberChange.description: An assessment of the copy number of a Location or a Gene within a system (e.g. genome, cell, etc.) relative to a baseline ploidy.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

subject.description: A location for which the number of systemic copies is described.

copy_change.description: MUST be one of "efo:0030069" (complete genomic loss), "efo:0020073" (high-level loss), "efo:0030068" (low-level loss), "efo:0030067" (loss), "efo:0030064" (regional base ploidy), "efo:0030070" (gain), "efo:0030071" (low-level gain), "efo:0030072" (high-level gain).

Genotype.description: A quantified set of _in-trans_ MolecularVariation at a genomic locus.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

members.description: Each GenotypeMember in `members` describes a MolecularVariation and the count of that variation at the locus.

count.description: The total number of copies of all MolecularVariation at this locus, MUST be greater than or equal to the sum of GenotypeMember copy counts. If greater than the total counts, this implies additional MolecularVariation that are expected to exist but are not explicitly indicated.

Location.description: A contiguous segment of a biological sequence.

ChromosomeLocation.description: A Location on a chromosome defined by a species and chromosome name.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

species_id.description: CURIE representing a species from the [NCBI species taxonomy](https://registry.identifiers.org/registry/taxonomy). Default: "taxonomy:9606" (human)

chr.description: The symbolic chromosome name. For humans, For humans, chromosome names MUST be one of 1..22, X, Y (case-sensitive)

start.description: The start cytoband region. MUST specify a region nearer the terminal end (telomere) of the chromosome p-arm than `end`.

end.description: The start cytoband region. MUST specify a region nearer the terminal end (telomere) of the chromosome q-arm than `start`.

SequenceLocation.description: A Location defined by an interval on a referenced Sequence.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

sequence_id.description: A VRS Computed Identifier for the reference Sequence.

start.description: The start coordinate or range of the SequenceLocation. The minimum value of this coordinate or range is 0. MUST represent a coordinate or range less than the value of `end`.

end.description: The end coordinate or range of the SequenceLocation. The minimum value of this coordinate or range is 0. MUST represent a coordinate or range greater than the value of `start`.

LiteralSequenceExpression.description: An explicit expression of a Sequence.

DerivedSequenceExpression.description: An approximate expression of a sequence that is derived from a referenced sequence location. Use of this class indicates that the derived sequence is *approximately equivalent* to the reference indicated, and is typically used for describing large regions in contexts where the use of an approximate sequence is inconsequential.

location.description: The location from which the approximate sequence is derived

reverse_complement.description: A flag indicating if the expressed sequence is the reverse complement of the sequence referred to by `location`

RepeatedSequenceExpression.description: An expression of a sequence comprised of a tandem repeating subsequence.

seq_expr.description: An expression of the repeating subsequence

count.description: The count of repeated units, as an integer or inclusive range

ComposedSequenceExpression.description: An expression of a sequence composed from multiple other Sequence Expressions objects. MUST have at least one component that is not a ref:`LiteralSequenceExpression`. CANNOT be composed from nested composed sequence expressions.

components.description: An ordered list of SequenceExpression components comprising the expression. MUST NOT have two adjacent LiteralSequenceExpression objects.

GenotypeMember.description: A class for expressing the count of a specific MolecularVariation present _in-trans_ at a genomic locus represented by a Genotype.

count.description: The number of copies of the `variation` at a Genotype locus.

variation.description: A MolecularVariation at a Genotype locus.

Number.description: A simple integer value as a VRS class.

DefiniteRange.description: A bounded, inclusive range of numbers.

IndefiniteRange.description: A half-bounded range of numbers represented as a number bound and associated comparator. The bound operator is interpreted as follows: '>=' are all numbers greater than and including `value`, '<=' are all numbers less than and including `value`.

comparator.description: MUST be one of "<=" or ">=", indicating which direction the range is indefinite

HumanCytoband.description: A character string representing cytobands derived from the *International System for Human Cytogenomic Nomenclature* (ISCN) [guidelines](http://doi.org/10.1159/isbn.978-3-318-06861-0).

Residue.description: A character representing a specific residue (i.e., molecular species) or groupings of these ("ambiguity codes"), using [one-letter IUPAC abbreviations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Union_of_Pure_and_Applied_Chemistry#Amino_acid_and_nucleotide_base_codes) for nucleic acids and amino acids.

Sequence.description: A character string of Residues that represents a biological sequence using the conventional sequence order (5’-to-3’ for nucleic acid sequences, and amino-to-carboxyl for amino acid sequences). IUPAC ambiguity codes are permitted in Sequences.

CategoricalVariation.description: A representation of a categorically-defined  [functional domain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_of_a_function)  for variation, in which individual variation instances may be members.

ComplexVariation.description: A categorical variation domain jointly characterized by two or more other categorical  variation domains.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

operands.description: The CategoricalVariation objects that are being evaluated collectively.

operator.description: The logical operation applied to evaluating the object *operands*. MUST be "AND" or "OR".

CanonicalVariation.description: A categorical variation domain characterized by a representative Variation context  to which members lift-over, project, translate, or otherwise directly align.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, and MUST be represented as a CURIE. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may also refer to an 'id' for the shared concept in  another system (represented by namespace, accordingly).

canonical_context.description: The [VRS Variation](https://vrs.ga4gh.org/en/1.2.1/terms_and_model.html#variation) object to which congruency must be determined.
